description: An illustration of two masks, each colored grayish blue on the left side and pale orange on the right, split evenly down the middle; both masks has holes for the wearer's eyes and mouth. The mask on the left has a scowling expression with an open mouth and the mask on the right has a smiling expression. These two masks are also known as "sock and buskin," two symbols of comedy (sock) and tragedy (buskin); the title of the puzzle ("Melpomene and Thalia") is a reference to the Greek muses of tragedy and comedy, respectively, who are often depicted holding these masks.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
